label: Description
value: Trompe l'oeil shade. Green louvered or venetian blinds with simulated chain along either edge. Printed in black and greens.

label: Description
value: Vertical border printed two across with neoclassical-style shell, volutes and rosettes framed within egg and dart motifs. Borders have shadows printed on opposite sides of motifs. Golds, white and gray on gray background.

label: Description
value: Faux aqua-colored marble brick or ashlar block pattern. A framework of crossed ribbons, acanthus diamonds and pyramid bosses encases each simulated marble block.
North Germany. Plate from "Dickinson's Comprehensive Pictures of the Great Exhibition of 1851," published 1854.

label: Description
value: View of the North German exhibit of the 1851 London Exposition showing carriage, chandelier and bird cages. Ironwork structure visible across top of image.
Austria No. 1: Plate from "Dickinson's Comprehensive Pictures of the Great Exhibition of 1851," published 1854.

label: Description
value:
View of the installation of the Austrian Pavilion at the 1851 London Exposition.
Image is dominated on the right by a large carved wooden bed with lush red hangings. Clusters of men and women are shown viewing exhibits.

label: Description
value: Classical design, with passementerie and architectural molding, including tassels, swag rope twist and lion head medallions.  Printed in seven colors including gold, orange and blue on yellow ocher ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Arabesque design with floral swags and two alternating pastoral scenes. One, horse drawn wagon followed by woman and sheep.  Two, shepherd with sheep and bull.  Figures printed in grisaille, swags in polychrome, all on green ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Birds and flowers in white bands.  "Bird of Paradise" document.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Arabesque design. Central motif of large bouqet of flowers in urn. Below and in front of this sits a ewer on a lambrequin. Rope swags and tassles suspended from rod which supports lambrequin.  Rose swag around lambrequin. Above the bouquet sits a cameo, with an urn on a balustrade against a pink background. The cameo is surrounded by a beaded framework. Printed in polychrome on a light blue-green ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Original document for "Diamond Damask". Blue diamonds in floral framework with brown striped overprinting. Printed on yellow ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Floral bouquets, with foliate swags and scrolls, printed in white on blue ground. A lacey white stripe runs vertically through the center of the paper.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Blue rose alternating with a blue rosette, in tile format. Printed on blue ground.

value: a) Overall: 71 x 24.5 cm (27 15/16 x 9 5/8 in.) b) Overall: 71 x 25 cm (27 15/16 x 9 13/16 in.) c) Overall: 18 x 16 cm (7 1/16 x 6 5/16 in.) d) Overall: 9.5 x 16 cm (3 3/4 x 6 5/16 in.) e) Overall: 14 x 10.5 cm (5 1/2 x 4 1/8 in.)

value: Sample removed from the Hampton Plantation, Charleston

value: Bandbox lid, the sides of which are broken in pieces but still attached. Printed in a bold black and white geometric pattern, resembling pyramids.

label: Description
value: Design containing flag, eagle with "Union" banner, stars and moon. The large moon and star contain faces. Printed on an orange and blue plaid background. Original document for "Eagle Plaid".

value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Two pieces mounted on corrugated cardboard. Foliate framework composing network of circles and squares. The point of intersection is covered by a floral motif. The circular framework contains a floral, snowflake or crystalline motif. The square framework contains a plant motif. Printed in green on white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: 2 different designs mounted on support. Narrow band of blue foliate sprigs on left edge, with wider band of American flag ribbons forming guilloche design. Another narrow band of blue foliate sprigs, with wider band containing American flags, cannon, shield and drum, alternating with eagle holding arrows and laurel sprigs. Printed in red, blue and green on off-white ground.

label: Provenance
value: This original document was found lining an old cupboard in General Trumbull's house. Note: Jonathan Trumbull Sr. was governor of Connecticut 1769-1784; Jonathan Trumbull, Jr. was governor of CT 1798-1809; John Trumbull, painter of American Revolution b. 1756-d. 1843.  Connecticut did not have a governor named Lathrop.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Pillar and arch design, featuring a memorial to George Washington. A bust of Washington is centered on a pyramid upon a pedestal. Trophies of war sit upon the plinth, including cannon cannon balls, drum, and flag. Many symbols of the Masons are contained in this design, including the all-seeing eye and the checkerboard floor. The pedestal sits between two columns. To the left are floral vines forming a pointed arch.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Notes
value: Pillar and arch design, featuring a memorial to George Washington. A bust of Washington is centered on a pyramid upon a pedestal. Trophies of war sit upon the plinth, including cannon cannon balls, drum, and flag. Many symbols of the Masons are contained in this design, including the all-seeing eye and the checkerboard floor. The pedestal sits between two columns. To the left are floral vines forming a pointed arch.

label: Description
value: A scalloped fish-scale design. Each frame contains a bird perched on a floral sprig. Design is flipped in alternating horizontal rows. Printed in 2 shades of blue on white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Diaper pattern with the repeating central motif of a fountain on a pedestal surrounded by an abundance of flowers. The diaper is formed of ribbon with bows. Printed in gray and green on a white ground. Original document for "The Fountain".

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Alternating wheat bundles and large leaves above ribbon twist on cable, with strung beads along the top. Printed in grisaille, green and blue with a brown ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Man in a boat with group of ducks swimming nearby. Another pair of men with horses sitting under trees. Classical buildings and ship in distance. Printed in green, gray and black on off-white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Central motif of parrot sitting on lace panel suspended from bunches of peacock feathers. This alternates with floral bouquet. Printed in varnished green, pink and white on yellow ground.

label: Provenance
value: This paper was found in an old Connecticut house.
